Name: Educational Institution
Description: An educational institution is an organization that provides formal education to students. It provides academic and/or specialized training programs at any level of education, including primary and secondary schools, colleges, universities, and professional and trade schools.

Properties.Name: Campuses
Properties.Description: Campuses of this institution. A campus represents the grounds on which an educational institution is located. Most institutions will have at least one campus, and many have multiple campuses (sometimes called satellite campuses).

Properties.Name: Colors
Properties.Description: The school's colors. Each color separately.

Properties.Name: Number of faculty
Properties.Description: The number of non-student lecturers, teachers and researchers at this institution.  These are typically staff members with an education/academic focus.

Properties.Name: Mascot
Properties.Description: A school's mascot may be a particular character (e.g. the University of Oklahoma's Sooner Schooner) or a general type of thing (e.g. Tiger, Bear, Spartan, etc.)

Properties.Name: Newspaper
Properties.Description: Newpapers published by the student body.

Properties.Name: Nickname
Properties.Description: The nickname for the students or sports teams. This is often different from (or a variant of) the mascot name - e.g. the University of Oklahoma mascot is the Sooner Schooner; the nickname is the Sooners.

Properties.Name: Number of staff
Properties.Description: The number of non-faculty employees at this institution.

Properties.Name: Phone number
Properties.Description: The primary or switchboard number for this institution

Properties.Name: Radio station
Properties.Description: A radio station run by this institution

Properties.Name: School magazines
Properties.Description: Magazines published by the student body of this institution. Professionally-published magazines and journals should not be entered in this property.

Properties.Name: School type
Properties.Description: School Categories to which this school belongs, such as Private, Public, Primary, Secondary, College, Community College, Boarding School, National University, and so on.

Properties.Name: Subsidiary Or Constituent Schools
Properties.Description: Subsidiary institutions (such as colleges of a university).

Properties.Name: Total Enrollment
Properties.Description: The enrollment of the entire student body, by year.
